content.p: A legislator, his spouse, or any business in which he or his spouse own or control an interest of more than five percent (5%) shall not intentionally lease or sell any facility, building, or other real property to a state agency while the legislator is a member of the General Assembly. This provision shall not apply to sales or leases made under threat of or pursuant to KRS , relating to eminent domain, and does not impair any lawful contract existing on September 16, 1993. This section shall not apply to a lease or sale for a nominal consideration if the lease or sale is preapproved by the commission. Violation of this section is a Class D felony, and the court upon conviction may void any sale or lease violating this provision.
